Name: MPI_Comm_create_group
Description: MPI_Comm_create_group is similar to MPI_Comm_create but MPI_Comm_create_group requires only to be called by all processes in group, which is a subgroup of the group of the old communicator. On the other hand, MPI_Comm_create is a collective operation within the communicator comm because all processes of comm must call it. MPI_Comm_Create_Group returns a new communicator for which the group argument defines the communication group. Each process must provide a group when calling MPI_Comm_create_group, this can be MPI_GROUP_EMPTY, if all the groups are MPI_GROUP_EMPTY, then the call is erroneous. For a successful call, at least one group must be non-empty, all the processes of that group must call MPI_Comm_create_group with the same arguments and their groups must have the same ordering. The tag argument cannot be MPI_ANY_TAG.

Parameters.Name: old_communicator
Parameters.Description: The communicator from which the group of processes is extracted.

Parameters.Name: group
Parameters.Description: The group containing the processes from the old_communicator to include in the new communicator. It can contain the entire group of processes of the old communicator, or just a subgroup or MPI_GROUP_EMPTY.

Parameters.Name: tag
Parameters.Description: If multiple threads at a given process perform concurrent MPI_Comm_Create_Group operations, the user must distinguish these operations by providing different tag or comm arguments

Parameters.Name: new_communicator
Parameters.Description: The variable in which store the communicator created. If the group of the calling process is MPI_GROUP_EMPTY, MPI_COMM_NULL is stored instead.

Return.Description:
The error code returned from the communicator creation.
- MPI_SUCCESS: the routine successfully completed.
